title: What To Know For This Fall And Winter Virus Season
content:
RSV vaccines for older adults
: CDC recommends RSV vaccines to protect adults ages 75 years and older and adults ages 60-74 years with certain health conditions and those who live in nursing homes. Currently, older adults only need to get the RSV vaccine once, not annually.
RSV immunizations to protect babies
: There are two ways to protect babies when they are most at risk of getting severe RSV disease.
Vaccination during pregnancy
